name: adnanh-webhook
description: webhook is a self-hosted lightweight HTTP server that executes shell commands in response to webhooks. It allows defining rules and payload filters via JSON configuration and is controlled through CLI.
features: HTTP endpoint creation: Define custom webhook URLs that trigger shell commands or scripts when called.
Payload filtering: Set up rules to validate incoming webhook payloads before executing commands.
JSON configuration: Define webhooks using simple JSON files with parameters, headers, and execution rules.
Request validation: Verify webhook authenticity using HMAC signatures, tokens, or IP whitelisting.
Command execution: Run shell scripts, system commands, or custom executables in response to webhook triggers.
Environment variables: Pass webhook payload data to scripts as environment variables for dynamic processing.
Response customization: Return custom HTTP responses with specific status codes and body content.
Logging system: Track all webhook invocations with detailed logs including payloads and execution results.
Concurrent handling: Process multiple webhook requests simultaneously with configurable worker limits.
Regex matching: Use regular expressions to match and extract data from webhook payloads.
Lightweight deployment: Minimal resource usage makes it suitable for running on edge devices or containers.
Security focused: Run commands with specific user permissions and implement rate limiting to prevent abuse.
